summary: This document is a chain of emails from whistleblower Christopher Dilorio to SEC officials, alleging a massive, ongoing fraud facilitated by the SEC. It centers on Environmental Solutions Worldwide, Inc. (ESWW), described as a money laundering shell co-invested in by Jeffrey Epstein and Apollo Global Management co-founder Leon Black. Dilorio accuses the SEC of corruptly protecting a network of individuals connected to Michael Milken while prosecuting outsiders.

events.description: The SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo Global Management a month after the firm loaned $180 million to Jared Kushner's family real estate business, following a meeting between Kushner and Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.

events.title: Whistleblower Threat Incident

keyFacts: Environmental Solutions Worldwide, Inc. (ESWW) is alleged to be a money laundering 'shell' company that was the ONLY SEC-disclosed financial entity connecting Jeffrey Epstein to Leon Black and Apollo Global Management.
The SEC filed a fraud complaint against ESWW in 2002 but allegedly allowed it to operate for 13 more years, during which time Black, his family, Apollo, and Epstein laundered millions through it.

The SEC is accused of having a 'Do Not Investigate List' that protects a network of individuals connected to Michael Milken, including Leon Black, Richard Ressler, and others, while prosecuting outsiders like Dan Kamensky and targeting whistleblower Christopher Dilorio.

A $180 million loan from Apollo to Jared Kushner's family business in 2018 is linked to the SEC's decision to drop an investigation into Apollo, following a meeting between Kushner and Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.

The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, claims to have repeatedly offered to have the SEC refute his allegations point-by-point at their DC headquarters, an offer he says they have never accepted because his claims are '100% accurate.'
